channel.description: Recent content in Fabio Geraci on Emanuele Viglianisi

item.title: YoloV5 Deployment Optimization with Neural Magic
item.description: Table Of Contents 🔥 Motivation: 🔫 What: 🚒 Why: ⛳ How: 🔩 Setting Up Table Resume Prediction Speed Metrics Test Set F1 Score Sample of video annotation 🙏 Comments & Feedback Follow me 👇 🔥 Motivation: Link to heading As architecture get more complex, for improved prediction results, the generated model are larger and larger, therefore the need to reduce their size and allow the model to run prediction on CPU.

item.title: The Garden Flower Challenge
item.description: Table Of Contents 🔥 Motivation 🔩 Set-Up Install libraries Import Libraries Utilities Functions Split Dataset into class Balanced sub-sets Selecting the Run-Device Adding Augmentation Creating the Pytorch DataLoader Creating the Learner and Adding CutMix Running the Learner 🔎 Reality Check Plotting ROC Curve Plotting Confusion Matrix Plotting the Top Losses 🧭 Conclusion 🙏 Comments & Feedback Follow me 👇 🔥 Motivation Link to heading This is a quite common “take home” challenge.

item.title: Negative Samples Dilemma In Object Detection
item.description: Table Of Contents 🔥 Motivation 🔫 Why 🔩 What are negative samples? 🩺 The Other Side 🙏 Comments & Feedback Follow me 👇 🔥 Motivation Link to heading This is the dilemma that every machine learning practitioners have faced it while working on object detection problem. In this blog, I will share my thoughts, in order to help new engineers in making the correct choices when they are setting up the dataset pipeline.

item.title: Comparing a transformer-based detector with a classical detector
item.description: Table Of Contents 🔥 Motivation 🔫 Dataset Description 🔩 Set-Up 🩺Results 👍 Coco Metric CNN 👍 Coco Metric Transformers 🙏 Comments & Feedback Follow me 👇 🔥 Motivation Link to heading Since the introduction, by Facebook, Transformer based detectors are getting a lot of traction in Computer Vision and Object Detection. In this blog, I will show how a partially trained detector using SWIN transformer backbone leads to a very competitive performance compared to a fully trained classical detector.
